verses.verse: “I have made a covenant with my eyes not to look with desire upon a virgin.
For what is man’s lot prescribed by God above, his inheritance from the Almighty on high?
Is it not destruction for the wicked and disaster for wrongdoers?
Does not God see my ways and number all my steps?
“If I have walked in falsehood or hastened my steps toward deceit,
let God weigh me on honest scales; then he will know that I am blameless.
“If my steps have wandered from the path of righteousness, or if my eyes have led my heart astray, or if any stain has besmirched my hands,
then let someone else eat what I sow, and let my crops be uprooted.
“If my heart has been enticed by a woman and I have lain in wait at my neighbor’s door,
then let my wife grind grain[c] for another and let other men enjoy her.
For that would be a heinous crime and judged as a criminal offense.
It would be a fire that leads to Destruction[d] until it consumes all my possessions completely.
“If I have ever rejected the pleas of my male or female slaves when they lodged a complaint against me,
what will I do when God confronts me? What will I answer if he calls me to account?
Did not he who formed me in the womb also make them? Did not the one God create all human beings?[e]
“Have I ignored the needs of the poor or caused the eyes of widows to overflow with tears?
Did I ever eat my bread alone without sharing it with an orphan,
I whom God has reared like a father and guided ever since I left my mother’s womb?
“Have I ever seen a stranger in need of clothing, or a poor wretch with nothing to cover him,
whose body has not blessed me after being warmed with the fleece of my sheep?
Have I ever raised my hand against the innocent, knowing that my friends would support me?
“If I have done any of these things, then let my shoulder blade fall from my shoulder and let my arm be torn from its socket.
For then the fear of God would overcome me and I would be unable to stand in his presence.
“Have I placed my faith in gold and regarded it as my security?
Have I rejoiced in my great wealth and the abundance of riches in my possession?
[f]Have I beheld the sun when it shone and the moon moving in its splendor
and ever found my heart to be secretly enticed so that I blew them a kiss in homage?
Any of these would be a serious offense, for I would have been unfaithful to God above.
[g]“Have I ever rejoiced at the ruin of my enemy or exulted when evil overtook him—
I who would not allow my tongue to sin by laying his life under a curse?
Have not those of my household said, ‘Who has not eaten his meat and been sated?’
No stranger has ever had to spend the night in the street; my door has always been open to the traveler.
“Have I ever concealed my transgressions as others do, keeping my guilt buried within my breast,
because I feared the gossip that would ensue, and I was terrified at the scorn of the multitude? If so, then I would have remained silent and not ventured out of doors.
[i]“Oh, if only I had someone to hear my defense and my accuser would write out his indictment!
I would wear it on my shoulder and place it on my head as a crown.
I would give him an account of my entire life, and like a prince I would present myself before him.
“If my land has cried out against me and its furrows have joined in the weeping,
if I have eaten its produce without payment and caused the death of its owners,
then let thistles grow instead of wheat and noxious weeds instead of barley.” The words of Job are ended.
